abstract: More small businesses are saving money by using Twitter and other sites to test their ideas before they invest in them.
snippet: More small businesses are saving money by using Twitter and other sites to test their ideas before they invest in them.
lead_paragraph: When starting a business, new entrepreneurs often spend time naming the business and developing a logo and printing business cards and perfecting the look and feel of their packaging before they know whether they have a viable product or service. There’s now a better way — social media has become the ultimate tool for market research. Stephanie Clifford wrote an article for The Times this week about how big corporations are replacing focus groups with social media, but it works for small businesses, too.

headline.main: Using Social Media to Test Your Idea Before You Try to Sell It

abstract: Bill George, a Harvard business professor, argues that investors should be focusing on Facebook’s future instead of wondering why it had lost so much of its I.P.O. value.
snippet: Bill George, a Harvard business professor, argues that investors should be focusing on Facebook’s future instead of wondering why it had lost so much of its I.P.O. value.
lead_paragraph: Bill George is a professor of management practice at Harvard Business School and a former chairman and chief executive of Medtronic.

headline.main: The Long-Term Value of Internet Companies
